sentences.english: Those who chose to be idle, certainly might.
sentences.chinese: 谁要是存心偷懒，当然也可以。

sentences.english: The new boss was determined to rid the company of all slackers.
sentences.chinese: 公司决定新人资老板可将公司所有偷懒者除名。

sentences.english: 1960s in a lazy and used cell phone text messaging to see.
sentences.chinese: 一只小猴在偷懒，拿着手机看短信。
事实上，这并不十分偷懒。

sentences.english: He got fired because he slacked off at work.
sentences.chinese: 他因为在工作中偷懒被炒了鱿鱼。

sentences.english: The messenger of duty however was not idle.
sentences.chinese: 责任的信使是不会偷懒的。

sentences.english: Li Ming had been fired for goofing-off at work.
sentences.chinese: 李明因上班偷懒而被开除了。

sentences.english: The coach often chews out lazy players.
sentences.chinese: 教练经常训斥偷懒的运动员。

sentences.english: Stop dawdling and help me with these suitcases.
sentences.chinese: 别偷懒了，快来帮我拿这些手提箱吧。

sentences.english: Nevertheless, it is the lazy abuse that disease of smooth fashionable dress rests to sanitarian room person.
sentences.chinese: 不过，是平时装病到保健室来休息的偷懒的恶习者。

sentences.english: I invested lots of time to be lazy.
sentences.chinese: 为了能够偷懒，我花了很大的功夫。

sentences.english: As expected I was not so good and I began to fool around and goof off.
sentences.chinese: 正如所料，我不太好，我开始瞎闹和偷懒。
工程师们都是会偷懒的。

sentences.english: Okay, let me be lazy and let me use my calculator.
sentences.chinese: 让我偷懒使用计算器吧。

sentences.english: When the boss found me goofing off, he came down on me like a ton of bricks.
sentences.chinese: 当老板发现我偷懒时，气势汹汹地训斥了我一顿。

sentences.english: I can't find Martin anywhere in the office, he must be skiving .
sentences.chinese: 我在办公室里哪儿也找不到马丁，他一定在偷懒。

definition: to be absent-minded/to desert/to abscond from the army/absent without leave (AWOL)
to disturb/to look for trouble/to stir up a row/to bother sb intentionally
tree trunk/main part of sth/to manage/to work/to do/capable/cadre/to kill (slang)/to fuck (vulgar)
to catch fish/(fig.) to loaf on the job/to be slack/to take it easy
to skimp/to work half-heartedly/not to bother
